bwwExcerpt: Juice.ph: "Red" is a relatively quiet play. It involves only two characters discussing art and while they do play music while working and later, as tensions rise, they start to raise their voices to shout at each other, it can't ever get too loud or busy on set because, well, there's just two people on stage at any given time, in a quiet studio of one artist. But "Red" gets very loud, on an intellectual level, because the text is so damned brilliant that it bellows and howls inside your head. It

the text is so damned brilliant
